page.title: 09THE SCHOOL IN DALMALLY
page.content: Dalmally Primary school was built in 1975 it is of a semi open plan design with a sizeable playing area,both grass and tarmac surrounding it. Within the school there are two closed classrooms and one open area for teaching. In addition we have a dining hall/gym staffroom two offices and a school kitchen. The school is large enough to accomodate 100 pupils but the role at the present time is 42 children. There are two teachers at the school at the present time,Mrs Parkes and Miss Mathieson. We are also lucky enough to have Mrs MacIntyre our auxillary to assist in the school. When the children have completed their seven years (from age 5) at this school they must travel to Oban each day (25miles) to attend Oban High School.
